Reviews.Title: “The location was very good”
Reviews.Author: daliasiani
Reviews.Content: The location was very good near termini station.Only two station in the metro to thr colosum.The rome small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “You won't listen to me, but I'll say it...DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerof5
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews we decided if we booked Hotel Center with our tour company it would ONLY be if we were guaranteed a room at Hotel Center 1. We were assured that was the case. However, when we arrived we were directed to Hotel Center 2. (Just like many reviews we read said they would) Between my broken Italian, and their broken English we got out that there was no room there and we would HAVE to go to #2. They would not budge, so we were forced to walk ourselves to the next location. It proved to be a nightmare. This hotel sits on top of an "after hours" disco tech that POUNDS ALL NIGHT on the weekends. Which of course was when we were there. We did not get a single nights sleep and the staff was unwilling to move us to Hotel Center #1. You'll think you know better than me, you'll say I can put up with a little noise, I don't mind a small room, who needs a shower that you can bend over in, BUT MARK MY WORDS YOU WILL REGRET IT! Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “I have never been treated so poorly in any hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Palentina2010
Reviews.Content: - The rooms are poorly ventilated, do not smell good. - There is no own regulation for air conditioning. Reception is regulated from, what it means to die of cold or heat. - The receptionist did not speak English. I always answer "yes" say what you say. - The owner of the hotel is beyond good and evil. Kindness is not one of his virtues. - The bathroom is leaking, noisy. Never came to fix it. - The breakfast is quite poor for a supposed 3 star hotel. - The wifi service: you can use after paying extortionate prices. - This 15-minute walk from Termini, it is not a good place to go back alone at night. - I do not recommend this hotel at all, would not return. The price and the stars do not do justice to the services offered. And above all, the deal is not good. It appears that you have to thank for being able to sleep there. I've been in several hotels on Rome, and I've never felt so ill treated.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Romanintheruins
Reviews.Content: My sister traveled to Rome for the first time and stayed at the Hotel Center 2. I went through trip advisor to get a review of the hotel as it was set up by the trip planner. I tried everything to change the hotel before we left, thank goodness I couldn't. This was one of the nicest places we had seen and when we told fellow travelers on the train about it, they were a bit jealous. They had modern rooms with no opening windows, close to traffic and lots of noise. We had the sound of roudy footbsllersw coming home and the nonstop horns, but we also had a great breeze and tall windows that let in all of the Rome atmosphere. Some people pay a fortune for rustic, we got booked into it. Small cozy rooms, the nicest people at the desk who showed us Americans how to get bus passes and mapped out the stops we needed for the day, and right in the middle of where we needed to be. I would styay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, near Termini station”
Reviews.Author: Schmilly
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before, via Gate 1 Travel (clearly the best value trip organizer around!). Arrived in Rome from Florence by train, and walked in minutes to the hotel. Rooms are newly modernized, clean, and a bit small -- but who cares since you're not in Rome to hang out in your hotel room! Close to the Rome subway, and therefore easy to get to all the attractions. Good breakfast and good coffee...just ask the waitress for an espresso (which the automated machine doesn't make), then add your own latte.

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: KamilaS3
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel - clean and tidy room, helpfull staff. One is not good- breakfasts ;)

Reviews.Title: “I checked out after 1/2 an Hour”
Reviews.Author: AFlaum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our Rome trip through an internet company, which is how we wound up at the Hotel Center. All I can say is that the hotel was so awful that we checked out 1/2 an hour after we checked in and moved to a different hotel. Do yourself a favor and go to Hotel Smeraldo. It's right in the center of Rome. The staff isn't the nicest but the rooms are great, inexpensive and the hotel is convenient to the Pantheon, The Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Campo del Fiori, etc.

Reviews.Title: “You call this a hotel?????”
Reviews.Author: importedinteriors
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world and never found a hotel as cheap as this one. 1. Its not close to the rail station, good 20 min walk via a rough neighborhood 2. They charge 20 euros for a tv remote, 12 inch tv that does not work 3. lights in the hallway turn on for a few seconds then turn off...you have a hard time opening your door 3. Cheap, few thin towels and one soap. 4. Shower is 14 x 14 inches, if you are a heavy set person, you will not be able to take a shower 5. Air Conditioning does not come on unless you beg the front desk to do so, most of the time, they dont answer the phone 6. Breakfast is a joke...a cup of coffee, a danish and some juice 7. shower leaked all night, could not sleep 8. only one electrical outlet in the room, if you use a cpap, you will have a hard time. 9. No tissues in the room, only toilet paper 10. Trains run in front of the hotel...good luck if your room faces the rails. LOUSY AREA, NOT CLOSE TO ANYTHING STAY AWAY FROM THIS ONE.

Reviews.Title: “A shame for Rome”
Reviews.Author: RF2
Reviews.Content: It is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at! If it was presented with 1 star, I would accept it as normal. I usually stay at 3 star hotels, sometimes at 4 star and what I saw here was far far away from a 3 star category. The walls were scratched, the ceiling has mould, the towels were torn, the TV was not working. Everything seemed like the hotel was last refurbished 20 years ago. The 3 star hotel I stayed at in Warsaw looked like a palace compared to the one in Rome. I have been in a 3 star hotel in a small country town in Bulgaria which was like heaven compared to Hotel Center 2.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: lyubobg
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was very poor. The milk was from a machine with terrible taste. Everything was dirty and worn-out which you can see on my pictures. You need to pay a deposit of 20 Euro for remote control. There was mould in the bathroom. The towel was torn. The bed was not comfortable. The plaster of the room was broken on one place. The shower had e problem. The old guy at the reception was not helpful at all and etc and etc. I really don't know how such hotel in a such big destination like ROME can have 3 stars. I feel I was cheated.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: kteresi_2000
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the first floor near the lobby. It was like sleeping in a dorm room on a cot. 1. It was very noisy due to the location. 2. The bathroom smelled like a sewer. 3. I have never seen towel like this before. They were a little heavier than a sheet. 4. Refrigerator was broken. 5. We had a 12'' T.V in the room. You had to pay for the T.V. I hear they would reimbursed you. We opted not to watch T.V. 6. Breakfast was coffee, juice and a pastries. Gate 1 Travel should remove this Hotel from it choices. Thanks for letting me vent, KLT Buffalo N.Y.

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable, but only just”
Reviews.Author: mdbg
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel through Gate1Travel and were appalled that this was considered a 3 star hotel. The room was just big enough to fit a double bed. And I really do mean, just! When my husband sat on the edge of the bed, his toes touched the door to the bathroom. The bed was a very thin mattress on a wire frame. It resembled the construction that is found in a fold-away bed in a sofa. In addition to being very cramped, the room was also very noisy. The walls were thin enough that we could hear the person on one side of our room snoring and the people in the other side talking. Also the electric trams started running quite early and continued until very late. The bath towels resembled kitchen tea towels both in terms of their size and the type of material. The continental breakfast left a lot to be desired as well. The coffee was very weak and the orange juice was watery. We typically visit Europe 2 or 3 times a year and have stayed in a variety of hotels. The location of this one was questionable and quite a hike from the main entrance of the Termini station. I would have been most uncomfortable walking in the area after dark on my own. The fact this hotel had a hair dryer in the bathroom was probably considered justification for awarding it 3 stars, but otherwise this was was a tourist class, 1-star, establishment in a rather desolate area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Disliked the Center 2”
Reviews.Author: Cana1Toronto
Reviews.Content: We just visited Rome, and while this hotel had a bit larger room than I expected, that and it's price is about all it had going for it. The desk person went out of his way to be miserable to everyone, being rude, grunting back answers. Day or night he always seemed to be there, and when the hotel locks up at night, you can hear him snoring behind the desk, where he sleeps - there is a partition that hides his bed. On our last day there a young lady was at the desk. She appeared friendly. The quality of food is poor. A crescent, prepackaged toast - thicker than melba toast, orange juice and instant coffee from a machine. There are tv's in the room but you can't use them unless you pay an extra 25 euros to get the piece of equipment that will allow you to access the tv, channels, etc. There is no internet service here. Asking for help from the desk person, can be a challenge, but don't let him intimidate you and he tries to. He turned the lights off a group of people who were talking in the gathering place, it was early evening, they were quietly playing cards. They do have maps at the hotel - ask for one because the maps are very good, much clearer than Frommers, etc, but don't ask the desk person for such things as dining references, etc (unless it is the young lady) as you will be disappointed and frustrated. Ask some of the friendly travellers there who have been there a couple of days. They can be of great assistance. There are hair dryers in the toilets, shampoo and soap. They use odd towels also, they are more like large dish clothes than towel. They are very thin. Our room had a stale smell and was in need of painting. It looked tired, drab and a bit run down. Luckily, the windows can be opened and this helps freshen things up. The beds are extremely small, they look and feel more like cots. This hotel has the potential to look nice with the marble and construction, but is run down and there is no immagination used to decorate. A good cleaning, some paint, some interesting pictures, brighter wall and bed coverings would help improve the look, along with a better breakfast, and most important some friendly, helpful hotel staff who will offer assistance. This hotel is located far from restaurants, bars, shops and is in a poor part of town. You can't just run out to get a bite to eat or shop or to see the sights; It's a long walk into town, although some buses and the metro are not too far away. This is not an area you want to walk at night. The only real positive is, the hotel was cheap and we didn't spend much time there. I'd rather have stayed in a hotel with a smaller room that had some ambiance, with people who cared at the desk; more a reflection of the hospitality and character of Rome. Check to see if there are equal priced hotels that are situated closer to town and have better write ups. If you're not staying here long, the best thing this hotel has going for it is price.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars hotel? I would say 2 stars hotel, maybe 2 ½ stars”
Reviews.Author: name_no_name
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, for one week in June 2008, through my travel agent . On the hotel webpage everything looks very nice but in reality this is a 2 stars hotel, maybe 2 ½ stars. The people from the reception were ok, friendly and helpful. I’ve been staying in one of the rooms 4xx, and it looks like everyone was carrying the luggage on the walls and not on the floor, the toilet and window was broken (probably someone was trying to use the window as the main entrance). For turning on / off the air conditioner in your room you have to ask the people from the reception to do it , and for the TV remote you have to leave at the reception a guaranty of 20 EUR. Another problem with this hotel is the outside noise. You can hear all the cars, trams and people who are passing in front of the hotel. If you are a diabetic is better to avoid the breakfast: a lot of croissants with chocolate and vanilla, some butter and marmalade, orange/pineapple drink and coffee. As location, the hotel is situated at 15-20 minutes walking from Termini Station and 10 minutes from Manzoni subway station. Also, you may take a bus or a tram from Piazza di Porta Magiore (2 minutes walking). My advice is to take the bus 571 from Piazza di Porta Magiore and you’ll reach very easily and in a short time Coloseo, Fori Imperiali, Piazza Venetia, etc. I would not stay here again. In Rome, take care with the taxi drivers and the restaurants waiters

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Center 2 Roma”
Reviews.Author: d2dave
Reviews.Content: Consisting of three neighbouring properties, Hotel Center 1, 2 and 3 is located in the centre of Rome, 500 metres from Termini railway station. Air-conditioned but you need to leave a deposit. for the remote control for both Air con and television, Rooms have modern decor and furnishings and all include bathrooms, televisions, minibars that was empty and direct dial phones. Room spotlessly clean. The four-storey buildings are serviced by elevators. Breakfast is served each morning from 7.30, this consisted of a Roll with Jam / marmalade. Multilingual staff on the 24 -hour help desk ,although the night staff had a personality problem. The location was noisy in the morning from around 6am as the trams and trains run past the hotel. Bus services excellent. Metro station two bus stops away (10 minute walk) which gives you access to the majority of Roma. Taking all into consideration excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “GROTTY!”
Reviews.Author: EuroTravellerLDN
Reviews.Content: The hotel consists of three buildings and you get allocated when you arrive. We were staying in Number 2. The staff at both (1 and 2) were monumentally rude (hiding from people, grunting, letting you wait 15 minutes and making you feel that serving you was a chore.) We arrived 11pm lugged our bags down (and up again) the slopey stairs and then 30 mins later (20 mins of noone being there) were told to go to number 2 ... 5 mins further down the road. Receptionist # 2 was rude, he signed us in and then told us how to get hotel access after 1am (use the room key in an access gate) he seemed gleeful when telling us if we forgot which gate to use then we would sleep on the road. The reception areas in 1 & 2 look pretty good (nothing special though) and probably give false hopes. The walk to the room was annoying, up stairs, downs stairs - just to get to the tiny lift. The room was a fair seze (we had a triple) but is VERY basic. There were punch/kick holes on the walls and other dirty marks. The air conditioning is centrally controlled and you have to request a temperature change form reception. There is no internet which is ridiculous in this day and age (no internet FULL STOP - no option of paying for it either). if you want to watch the in-room old TV then you need to give a Euro20 deposit for the remote control (in itself ridiculous for a '3' star) The bathrooms are the worst feature of this hotel. The shower was RIDICULOUS. It was grotty and within 4 mins it began to flood as the plug hole was blocked somewhere along the pipes so you had to wait whilst the water went before resuming the shower. The towels were effectively bed sheets and so pretty useless. Bed sheets were clean however. This is a basic hotel that does not want you to know it is, it is cheap for Rome but expensive for other Continental European cities of an equivalent standard. Reception staff are rude, Maids seemed friendly. The hotel is in a grotty area (smells of urine, also some homeless people wandering around). This was not really a problem though as we didnt hang about. The hotel is about a 10/15 minute walk from Termini station which has never claimed to be a nice part of Rome and if you can overlook the grot you can benefit form being near the huge and impressive central station.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Gemstone7
Reviews.Content: Anyone wishing to travel to the hotel in Rome beware that the train finishes at nine and the only way to get there is by taxi (very expensive) or by bus,( smelly, scary and very dirty). The hotel it self is no where near the centre of rome as we were promised and is at least a 30 minute walk from the termini. The area in which it is sitauated is extremely run down and dirty. There are no restaturants or bars in the vacinity. We were only there for two nights which was long enough. The rooms are extremely noisy and the double bed is in fact two single beds pushed together. There are a great number of vagrants and dodgy people hiding about the alley ways. The staff were not helpful t all and the towels and 'tracing paper'. Would not recommend anyone staying here? Get out of it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Property Not Safe in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: USAWorldtraveler
Reviews.Content: A member of my group had her purse taken in the dining area. Purse contained her passport, credit cards, money, and other vaulables. Hotel not secure:anyone can walk in; no security cameras. My phone never worked. The young girls at the desk were very helpful and friendly; the older man was not.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is No Where Near The Centre”
Reviews.Author: graffitti
Reviews.Content: Despite the Hotel being named the Center Hotel, it is no where near the Center. It is at least 30 mins walk through some seedy areas. The Hotel itself is more than basic. In fact it offers very little more than a bed, if you call small camp bed type mattresses beds! The towels were the same thickness as the sheets. Breakfast involved machine coffee and juice with bread roll only. Staff unhelpful. The surrounding area for the Hotel was possibly the worst run down area I have ever been in and walking to the nearest restaurant was a frightening experience. I would never go back to this Hotel even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but by no means cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was described by the hotel broker as being convenient for the Termini Station. Well if you call having to drag our cases 3km along cobbled streets convenient ?? The hotel is located in what has to be one of the most depraved areas of Rome surrounded by drunks and beggars and very few restaurants or bars and directly opposite a tram station. The continental breakfast was laughable giving a selection of bread rolls...and thats it. Granted, the place was clean but the rooms were beyond basic with terrible lighting and plumming. We were woken every morning when our neighbour went to the toilet or had a shower as it sounded like he was taking it in our room!! Its a hotel miles from anywhere with no character and nothing that would make me go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: DanZulu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Center Two in December of 2005. We have both traveled around the world, from the Middle East to the British Isles. We are fairly independent travelers, who dislike group tours and prefer to explore on our own. We had reservations for Hotel Center, and walked there from the Termini train station. The first thing we noticed was how bad the area was. A few blocks from the hotel we passed an abandonded car, all the windows shattered, filled with trash, and walls of garbage surrounding the car. This gives you an image of the area, worse than the usual Roman graffiti. When we arrived at the Hotel Center lobby, we were somewhat relived that the lobby looked nice. Then the receptionist said "yes, we have your reservation, at our other building, go back outside, walk down the street, take your second right, and ring the buzzer". This was a short walk, but we were not impressed. This building was much more cramped, and the gentleman at the reception counter was smoking right beneath the no smoking sign. We wouldn't have minded much, but soon we realized that this smoke carried down the hall to our room. We also had a bar underneath our room, which played music until 4 in the morning. The bathroom was not especially clean, and the shower stall was so small you couldn't turn around without opening the curtain (I am an average size male, not obese). The bath towels were paper thin, and when we asked for an extra set, they tried to give us an extra floormat instead. One evening we returned to our room to find that the maid had opened both our window and the metal shutters, which was bad because the window was accessible from the rooftop patios. We wondered if he/she did this to allow someone else easy access later, or if maybe our room was warm and they wanted to cool it off for us. Being in Rome, we assumed the first. Nothing was missing, fortunately. We will not stay here again. It was such a long walk to any place of importance in Rome, we'll pay the extra money next time and get a better location and avoid the bottom of the barrel amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, very clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Members of my family spent four nights at the Hotel Center 2 in Rome in Dec. 2004. Our travel agency, Gate1 Travel, gave us transport vouchers to "Center Hotel" but we found on arrival that we'd been placed in Center 2 down the street. There are three Hotel Centers in same area. Ours was Euro modern, marble floors throughout, very clean, toilet with built-in bidet, thin continental towels instead of Turkish, rooms quite small. Center 2 had an elevator. Continental breakfast with good Rosetta rolls and excellent cafe au lait but no restaurant or bar. Desk helpful with only moderate English. Lots of street car and motorbike noise. Cable TV gets about 40 Italian channels, CNN in English only in early morning hours. Close to the Termini train terminal and the ancient Porta Maggiore city gate of emperor Claudius. Easy walk to Colosseum and historic sites. Not close to Vatican. Hotel neighborhood marginal--watch your wallet. Very good Tavula Calda restaurant nearby on via Porta Maggiore with tourist-friendly family staff.

Reviews.Title: “good service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel.. Good service.. They really try to help you when you ask for help..

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Center 2
HotelInfo.Address: Via G. Giolitti 441-443, 00185 Rome, Italy
